info.title: InEight InEight Application v1 Direct API

get.summary: Get an Action instance.

data.description: Contains the input object to the Action POST call.

result.description: This object definition is defined on each Action POST.  See Responses: "x-$.result for Successful" and "x-$.result for Failed" for the specific action based on the $.dataObjectCode and $.actionCode properties.

get.summary: Gets all Employees objects from the cache.

post.summary: Search through Employees objects in the data cache
post.description: InEight employee data object.

modifiedUtcAfter.description: Returns objects that were modified after the specified date (ISO 8601 format).  Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.fffffffZ.  Example '2019-12-11T20:16:58.3419275Z'.  If provided on the first call, the same value must be provided on all subsequent calls as you use the continuation token for the next result set.

modifiedUtcBefore.description: Returns objects that were modified before the specified date (ISO 8601 format).  Format: yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.fffffffZ.  Example '2019-12-11T20:16:58.3419275Z'.  If provided on the first call, the same value must be provided on all subsequent calls as you use the continuation token for the next result set.

continuationToken.description: Supplying this token will result in retrieving the next chunk of data if the first request contained more than 100 (up to) records or greater than 1 megabyte in size.  On your first call, you must omit or provide an empty string.  On subsequent calls, provide the continuationToken from the previous result.

propertyName.description: Name of the property to apply the filter on. Nested properties are supported with a dot (.) delimiter.  E.g. 'PONumber' or 'Sender.LastName'.

value.description: You must match the JSON type value to the propertyName JSON type.  There is no type coercion.

propertyName.description: Name of the property to apply the filter on. Nested properties are supported with a dot (.) delimiter.  E.g. 'PONumber' or 'Sender.LastName'.

value.description: You must match the JSON type value to the propertyName JSON type.  There is no type coercion.

value.description: You must match the JSON type value to the propertyName JSON type.  There is no type coercion.

propertyName.description: Name of the property to apply the filter on. Nested properties are supported with a dot (.) delimiter.  E.g. 'PONumber' or 'Sender.LastName'.

value.description: This oneOf option is to be used for null values for all data types.  You must match the JSON type value to the propertyName JSON type.  There is no type coercion.

filters.description: All provided filters are combined with AND conditions. E.g. filter1 AND filter2 AND filter3.  Not providing a filter will result in an unfiltered result.  Filtering can be performed on nested object properties but can not be performed on array item properties.  If provided on the first call, the same value must be provided on all subsequent calls as you use the continuation token for the next result set.

continuationToken.description: Supply this token on the next request to get the next chunk of data. This will have a value if the result set contains more than 100 records or the set is greater than 1 megabyte.

SourceSystemId.description: The unique identifier provided by the system of record for Vendors

SourceSystemName.description: The name of the system of record for Vendors

VendorCode.description: The public unique identifier for a Vendor

AlternateName.description: An alternate name that may be assigned to the vendor to aid searches.

Address2.description: An optional second line for the street address of the vendor.

ZipCode.description: Postal or zip code of the vendor.

City.description: City where the vendor is located.

RegionISOCode.description: The ISO 3166-2 Code for the region of the vendor.

CountryISOCode.description: The ISO Alpha-2 code for the country of the vendor.

DefaultPaymentTerms.description: Optional payment terms that will be defaulted when the vendor is added to a contract.

DefaultINCOTerms.description: Optional International Commercial (INCO) Terms that will be defaulted when the vendor is added to a contract.

DefaultINCOTermsLocation.description: Optional location at which risk passes from seller to buyer per the specified INCO Terms

VendorTypeReference.description: Optional reference to a Vendor Type. If used, data provided in this field must match a valid record in the Vendor Type Master Data located in Platform.

VendorTaxJurisdiction.description: An optional Tax Jurisdiction Code that can be included when sending Invoice and Pay Requests from Contracts to an external system. This field may also be optionally used to when requesting tax details from an external taxation system for contract line items.

VendorTaxId.description: Optional Tax Identification number issued for the vendor from a government tax authority (typically IRS for US Vendors)

get.summary: Gets one Daily Plan Work Orders object from the cache.
get.description: This integration allows a master list of work orders generated by an external system to be maintained within InEight Plan. post.summary: Executes the Add action for the Daily Plan Work Orders data object.
post.description: Adds a daily plan work order to the specific project ID (DisplayId) for the given equipment ID (SourceSystemId)

WorkOrderDisplayId.description: Unique identifier of the work order created by the system of record that is understood by users in InEight cloud platform when searching for work orders.

EquipmentSourceSystemId.description: Unique identifier of the equipment that the work order is for. This must match an existing record from the Equipment integration.

WorkOrderStatusDisplay.description: Status to be displayed for the work order in InEight cloud platform. Possible values that can be sent for this field are Open and Closed

Description.description: Text name and description of the work order to help users when searching for work orders.

SourceSystemId.description: Unique identifier for the work order that is created by the system of record and used as the method of specifying records when exchanging data between systems.

SourceSystemName.description: Name of the source system from where the data is sourced.

WorkOrderTypeDisplay.description: Text value representing the type of work order that is shown when users search for work orders in the InEight cloud platform. The values allowed for this field are preloaded into the InEight cloud platform and cannot be edited in current versions. Possible values are: '500','Preventative Maintenance', '510','Engine & Exhaust', '520','Power Train', '530','Frame & Cab', '540','Undercarriage Or Tires', '550','Implements', '560','Electrical System', '570','Hydraulic System', '580','Cooling System', '590','Brakes Or Steering System', '600','Air Or Lube System', '610','Standing Work Order', 'NA','Not Applicable'

ProjectDisplay.description: Unique identifier (DisplayId) of the project that the work order is assigned.

TimesheetNumber.description: Billings Timesheet number to use for the item. If a record contains a blank TimesheetNumber value, the import will group all import items by ProjectCode and create one Timesheet in the Billings product to contain the imported Line Item records.

ItemType.description: Identifier as to type of item that the record is. Acceptable values are: Personnel, Equipment, Material, LineItem, Other

PersonnelCode.description: Resource code that uniquely identifies the person the line item relates to, as per the master resource profile. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Personnel, LineItem or Other.

PersonnelType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of LabourType. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Personnel or LineItem.

EquipmentCode.description: Resource code that uniquely identifies the piece of equipment the line item relates to, as per the master resource profile. Note: EquipmentUnitNumber OR EquipmentCode can be used to identify a piece of equipment. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Equipment, LineItem or Other.

EquipmentUnitNumber.description: Resource unit # that uniquely identifies the piece of equipment the line item relates to, as per the master resource profile. Note: EquipmentUnitNumber OR EquipmentCode can be used to identify a piece of equipment. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Equipment, LineItem or Other.

EquipmentType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of EquipmentType. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Equipment or LineItem.

MaterialCode.description: Resource code that uniquely identifies the material the line item relates to, as per the master resource profile. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Material, LineItem or Other.

MaterialType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of MaterialType. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Material or LineItem.

SupplierCode.description: Unique code used to identify the company/vendor the line item relates to. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is LineItem or LineItem.

SourceOtherType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of OtherResourceType. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Other.

LineItemType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of LineItemType

WBSCodePath.description: Codes from each level of Project. Contains code from Project (root project code value), plus the code from all WBS levels and cost code code, relevant to placement of record within timesheet. Separated segments with \.

WBSPhaseCode.description: Mapped value from Control. This value directly relates to WBSCodePath.

PayItem.description: Mapped value from Control. This value directly relates to WBSCodePath.

WorkOrderCode.description: Work Order code that uniquely identifies the work order the line item relates to, as per the project specific work order list.

UserDef1.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a string and can therefore be used to capture vendor invoice #, or other relevant info.

UserDef2.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a string and can therefore be used to capture vendor invoice #, or other relevant info.

UserDef3.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a number and can therefore be used to capture vendor subcontractor hours, aboriginal hours, or any other number value specific to aid in reporting or processing of LEM or invoice information.

UserDef4.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a number and can therefore be used to capture vendor subcontractor hours, aboriginal hours, or any other number value specific to aid in reporting or processing of LEM or invoice information.

This is a number and can therefore be used to capture vendor subcontractor hours, aboriginal hours, or any other number value specific to aid in reporting or processing of LEM or invoice information

UserDef10.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a number and can therefore be used to capture vendor subcontractor hours, aboriginal hours, or any other number value specific to aid in reporting or processing of LEM or invoice information

LineItemDate.description: Item date associated to the record being processed. A common use for identifying a date for line item entries, is when processing billable accounts payable records, where the invoice date, or invoice payment date, may be used in identifying the date that the record is associated to.

UOM.description: The unit of measure associated to the record in terms of how it is going to be charged to the client. Each and lump sum are common ones used when processing vendor invoices using subtotal amounts(either by invoice, or invoice line item), but are not limited to those options.

Qty.description: The number used as the basis for multiplying against the rate.

Rate.description: The value of the record that is used to multiply against the quantity.

Amount.description: TThe quantity multiplied by the rate. Alternatively, the amount can be entered directly, in which the quantity and rate are not used to calculate the amount. This is the value that is used as the basis for the application of project markup amounts. For example, if the amount is $100, and there is a 6% markup for this particular Line Item type, then the following is true: Cost rate = $100; Markup amount = $6; LEM or Invoice total = $106.

DocumentImage.description: [CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED] PDF or JPG scan of supporting document (e.g., work ticket, invoice, PO, etc.)

SourceSystemId.description: The unique identifier provided by the system of record for Vendors

SourceSystemName.description: The name of the system of record for Vendors

VendorCode.description: The public unique identifier for a Vendor

AlternateName.description: An alternate name that may be assigned to the vendor to aid searches.

Address2.description: An optional second line for the street address of the vendor.

ZipCode.description: Postal or zip code of the vendor.

City.description: City where the vendor is located.

RegionISOCode.description: The ISO 3166-2 Code for the region of the vendor.

CountryISOCode.description: The ISO Alpha-2 code for the country of the vendor.

DefaultPaymentTerms.description: Optional payment terms that will be defaulted when the vendor is added to a contract.

DefaultINCOTerms.description: Optional International Commercial (INCO) Terms that will be defaulted when the vendor is added to a contract.

DefaultINCOTermsLocation.description: Optional location at which risk passes from seller to buyer per the specified INCO Terms

VendorTypeReference.description: Optional reference to a Vendor Type. If used, data provided in this field must match a valid record in the Vendor Type Master Data located in Platform.

VendorTaxJurisdiction.description: An optional Tax Jurisdiction Code that can be included when sending Invoice and Pay Requests from Contracts to an external system. This field may also be optionally used to when requesting tax details from an external taxation system for contract line items.

VendorTaxId.description: Optional Tax Identification number issued for the vendor from a government tax authority (typically IRS for US Vendors)

ProjectDisplay.description: Identifies the project associated with the Actuals request that was received. The ID is unique to a project and is its SourceSystemId.

PhaseCode.description: WBS phase code associated with the cost item for the Actuals record.

CBSPositionCode.description: CBS Position Code associated with the cost item for the Actuals record.

PostingDate.description: A date that indicates which financial period the cost, manhours, equipment hours or quantities will be associated to.

Quantity.description: Claimed amount of operational quantity for the cost item

ManHours.description: Claimed amount of manhours for the cost item

EquipmentHours.description: Claimed amount of equipment hours for the cost item

Amount.description: Name of the external system that is using the integration. Work with InEight to provision a unique value for this field.

CostCategories.description: Array header of the cost categories records.  All fields within this array may be repeated for each cost item that has data.

Actuals.description: Array header of the cost item records for Actuals. All fields within this array may be repeated for each cost item that has data.

SourceSystemId.description: Identifier created by the "system of record" and used in all system communications as the primary method of specifying a unique record. This field does not display in normal use of Project Suite applications and may contain internal identifiers such as a GUID that is not understandable by typical system users.

SourceSystemName.description: Name of the external system that is using the integration. Work with InEight to provision a unique value for this field.

WorkOrderDisplayId.description: Unique identifier of the work order created by the system of record that is understood by users in InEight cloud platform when searching for work orders.

EquipmentSourceSystemId.description: Unique identifier of the equipment that the work order is for. This must match an existing record from the Equipment integration.

WorkOrderStatusDisplay.description: Status to be displayed for the work order in InEight cloud platform. Possible values that can be sent for this field are Open and Closed

Description.description: Text name and description of the work order to help users when searching for work orders.

SourceSystemId.description: Unique identifier for the work order that is created by the system of record and used as the method of specifying records when exchanging data between systems.

SourceSystemName.description: Name of the source system from where the data is sourced.

WorkOrderTypeDisplay.description: Text value representing the type of work order that is shown when users search for work orders in the InEight cloud platform. The values allowed for this field are preloaded into the InEight cloud platform and cannot be edited in current versions. Possible values are: '500','Preventative Maintenance', '510','Engine & Exhaust', '520','Power Train', '530','Frame & Cab', '540','Undercarriage Or Tires', '550','Implements', '560','Electrical System', '570','Hydraulic System', '580','Cooling System', '590','Brakes Or Steering System', '600','Air Or Lube System', '610','Standing Work Order', 'NA','Not Applicable'

ProjectDisplay.description: Unique identifier (DisplayId) of the project that the work order is assigned.

PlanId.description: Unique identifier of the daily plan where the hours were reported for the employee.

PlanDate.description: Date on which the daily plan hours were performed.

PlanTitle.description: Name given to the daily plan where the hours were entered.

TimecardId.description: Unique identifier of the time card record.

TimeCardType.description: Indicates what type of timecard is being sent. Labor, Equipment, Labor-Equipment, Administrative, Maintenance

CreatedDate.description: Date when this specific time card version, was originally created.

ModifiedDate.description: Date when the this specific time card version was last modified.

Executor.description: Unique identifier of the employee representing the role of Executor on the daily plan.

Shift.description: Name or abbreviated code of the shift represented by the daily plan. Shift names are custom-defined in Plan application settings.

ShiftStartDateTime.description: The default datetime that the crew began work for a specific daily plan.

ShiftEndDateTime.description: The default datetime that the crew completed work for a specific daily plan.

ShiftStartDateTime.description: The datetime that a specific employee began work for a specific daily plan.

ShiftEndDateTime.description: The datetime that a specific employee completed work for a specific daily plan.

EmployeeShiftDetails.description: Array of employees that worked within the shift on the daily plan.

Trade.description: Unique identifier from the trade system of record for the employee/time card.  The system will evaluate Project Employee Trade first (if present), and Employee Trade second

Craft.description: Unique identifier from the craft system of record for the employee/time card.  The system will evaluate Project Employee Craft first (if present), and Employee Craft second

EmployeeId.description: Unique identifier from the HR system of record of the employee. This must match the employees SourceSystemId.

EquipmentId.description: Equipment that was operated while performing labor operations for reported hours. This value is based on the SourceSystemId received from an external system.

EmployeeReasonCode.description: One of the following: Reason code for labor hours,  Reason code for allowances, if the time card is for allowance only.Each allowance given to an employee for the day will be on a separate time card with zero hours.Each reason code/hours combination for an employee are on a separate time card. NOTE: The exception is when there are hours worked and equipment operated (linked). In this case, the employee reason code is in this field and the equipment reason code is in the equipment reason code field on the same time card.

EmployeeBillingClass.description: A description of the type of work performed by the employee which will be used to bill to the client.

EquipmentReasonCode.description: If the hours entered in a daily plan are for operated equipment and a reason code was selected for the block of hours, the reason code will be reported here.

LaborHourType.description: The hour type associated with the reason code on the timecard.

EmployeeHours.description: This field is used to for employee activities hours that are entered on the time card. When the time card represents work against a work order, the hours spent on the work order is shown here.

EquipmentHours.description: Hours reported for equipment being operated during labor operations.

Version.description: Current version of the Time Card. Versioning starts at 0 and is incremented each time it is resent to the receiving system.

Segment1.description: First segment of the cost item associated with the hours.

Segment2.description: Second segment of the cost item associated with the hours.

Segment3.description: Third segment of the cost item associated with the hours.

Segment4.description: Fourth segment of the cost item associated with the hours.

WorkOrder.description: Unique identifier for a work order if one was selected for the hours. This value is based on the SourceSystemId received from an external system.

MaintenanceEquipmentId.description: Unique identifier for the equipment that was either specified by a work order, or the selected equipment for maintenance hours. A value for this field is only present if a work order was selected for the hours. This value is based on the SourceSystemId received from an external system.

OverrideTrade.description: If the trade has been overridden on the time card from the default trade assigned to the employee, this field will show the overridden TradeId value.

OverrideCraft.description: If the craft has been overridden on the time card from the default craft assigned to the employee, this field will show the overridden CraftId value.

items.description: Array for the list of all premium code payroll indicators belonging to the premiums category that were assigned to this specific time card version.

Name.description: Name of the time card characteristic for which the value is being set. This field may be repeated as needed within the TimeCardCharacteristic list. Available options for name are EmployeeCostType and EquipmentCostType.

Value.description: Value of the time card characteristic name. This field may be repeated for each characteristic name provided.

TimeCardCharacteristics.description: Array header for the custom-defined fields used in the daily plan and associated with the hours in the time card. Within this array, any characteristic name/value pair may be repeated if there are hours in the time card for multiple resource types (e.g. Labor and Equipment).

AdditionalPayrollInstructionCodeOverridd.description: If the Allow Additional Payroll Instruction Code for the employee has been modified (changed or removed) for the time card for any reason, this field will show as true.

IsActive.description: If the timecard is active, this field will show true

ProjectId.description: DisplayId of the project associated with the daily plan.

WBSPhaseCode.description: WBS phase code for the cost item that the payroll indicator was assigned.

BillingCode.description: One of the following: Billing code for the employee reason code used in the Project,  Billing code for the extra pay used in the Project, if the time card is for allowance only.

EquipmentBillingCode.description: Billing code for the equipment reason code used in the Project.

Premium.description: Premium code associated with the employee/maintenance reason code.

BillingCode.description: Billing code for the employee/maintenance premium used in the Project.

PremiumList.description: Array header for premiums associated to the employee reason code.

ProjectSourceSystemId.description: Identifier created by the system of record and used in all system communications as the primary method of specifying a unique record. This field does not display in normal use of InEight applications and can contain internal identifiers such as a GUID that is not understandable by typical system users.

ProjectSourceSystemName.description: Name of the external system that is using the integration. Work with InEight to provision a unique value for this field.

ProjectDisplayId.description: Unique identifier that is publicly recognizable. This field is displayed in normal use of InEight applications. The value sent in this field can match SourceSystemId if there is no need to use a public versus private unique identifier.

IsAdvancedWorkAndSchedulingFeaturesEnabl.description: The planned duration of the project in days

GlobalOptions.description: Use this to set Global Options of the project

ProjectInformationTags.description: Use this to set Information Tags of the Project.

ListName.description: Name of the list that's added to the custom label

FieldValues.description: Comma delimited array of strings with a NON-DUPLICATE list of all field values that are part of the custom list

FuelTypeDisplay.description: The name of the type of fuel used

UOMSourceSystemId.description: The value provided in this field must match a valid Unit of Measure previously provided or defined in your InEight system.

CurrencyCode.description: The currency used to purchase the fuel. The value provided in this field must match a currency code in the InEight cloud platform and that which is selected for the project.

UnitCost.description: Value of the fuel per unit of measure

AccountCodeReference.description: Account code of the record that will be shown in normal use of product platform applications to assist users when performing searches or selections for particular work completed.

FuelTypes.description: Parent field for fuel type record

TimesheetNumber.description: Billings Timesheet number to use for the item. If a record contains a blank TimesheetNumber value, the import will group all import items by ProjectCode and create one Timesheet in the Billings product to contain the imported Line Item records.

ItemType.description: Identifier as to type of item that the record is. Acceptable values are: Personnel, Equipment, Material, LineItem, Other

PersonnelCode.description: Resource code that uniquely identifies the person the line item relates to, as per the master resource profile. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Personnel, LineItem or Other.

PersonnelType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of LabourType. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Personnel or LineItem.

EquipmentCode.description: Resource code that uniquely identifies the piece of equipment the line item relates to, as per the master resource profile. Note: EquipmentUnitNumber OR EquipmentCode can be used to identify a piece of equipment. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Equipment, LineItem or Other.

EquipmentUnitNumber.description: Resource unit # that uniquely identifies the piece of equipment the line item relates to, as per the master resource profile. Note: EquipmentUnitNumber OR EquipmentCode can be used to identify a piece of equipment. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Equipment, LineItem or Other.

EquipmentType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of EquipmentType. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Equipment or LineItem.

MaterialCode.description: Resource code that uniquely identifies the material the line item relates to, as per the master resource profile. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Material, LineItem or Other.

MaterialType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of MaterialType. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Material or LineItem.

SupplierCode.description: Unique code used to identify the company/vendor the line item relates to. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is LineItem or LineItem.

SourceOtherType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of OtherResourceType. NOTE: This field is only used if the ItemType value is Other.

LineItemType.description: Valid value from Code Values list, filtered for CodeType of LineItemType

WBSCodePath.description: Codes from each level of Project. Contains code from Project (root project code value), plus the code from all WBS levels and cost code code, relevant to placement of record within timesheet. Separated segments with \.

WBSPhaseCode.description: Mapped value from Control. This value directly relates to WBSCodePath.

PayItem.description: Mapped value from Control. This value directly relates to WBSCodePath.

WorkOrderCode.description: Work Order code that uniquely identifies the work order the line item relates to, as per the project specific work order list.

UserDef1.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a string and can therefore be used to capture vendor invoice #, or other relevant info.

UserDef2.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a string and can therefore be used to capture vendor invoice #, or other relevant info.

UserDef3.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a number and can therefore be used to capture vendor subcontractor hours, aboriginal hours, or any other number value specific to aid in reporting or processing of LEM or invoice information.

UserDef4.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a number and can therefore be used to capture vendor subcontractor hours, aboriginal hours, or any other number value specific to aid in reporting or processing of LEM or invoice information.

UserDef5.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a string and can therefore be used to capture vendor invoice #, or other relevant info.

UserDef6.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a string and can therefore be used to capture vendor invoice #, or other relevant info.

UserDef7.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a string and can therefore be used to capture vendor invoice #, or other relevant info.

UserDef8.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a string and can therefore be used to capture vendor invoice #, or other relevant info.

UserDef9.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a number and can therefore be used to capture vendor subcontractor hours, aboriginal hours, or any other number value specific to aid in reporting or processing of LEM or invoice information

UserDef10.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured. This is a number and can therefore be used to capture vendor subcontractor hours, aboriginal hours, or any other number value specific to aid in reporting or processing of LEM or invoice information

LineItemDate.description: Item date associated to the record being processed. A common use for identifying a date for line item entries, is when processing billable accounts payable records, where the invoice date, or invoice payment date, may be used in identifying the date that the record is associated to.

UOM.description: The unit of measure associated to the record in terms of how it is going to be charged to the client. Each and lump sum are common ones used when processing vendor invoices using subtotal amounts(either by invoice, or invoice line item), but are not limited to those options.

Qty.description: The number used as the basis for multiplying against the rate.

Rate.description: The value of the record that is used to multiply against the quantity.

Amount.description: TThe quantity multiplied by the rate. Alternatively, the amount can be entered directly, in which the quantity and rate are not used to calculate the amount. This is the value that is used as the basis for the application of project markup amounts. For example, if the amount is $100, and there is a 6% markup for this particular Line Item type, then the following is true: Cost rate = $100; Markup amount = $6; LEM or Invoice total = $106.

DocumentImage.description: [CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED] PDF or JPG scan of supporting document (e.g., work ticket, invoice, PO, etc.)

CodeType.description: Identifies lookup by type. Check API documentation for field values

CodeSubType.description: If the lookup is nested (e.g., Country then State or Country then Province), then contains the second level type identifier

CodeValue.description: Value of the list item stored in database tables

Description.description: Long description used in user interface and reports

DisplayOrder.description: Integer for ordering list of values by CodeType and CodeSubType

IsActive.description: Row status indicator, either Y for active or N for inactive

ShortDescription.description: Short description used in user interface and reports

SystemFlag.description: Flag indicating if the user can modify the row using user interface screens

Value1.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured.

Value2.description: Available field that can be used to identify client specific attributes associated to the record being captured.

unauth.description: You have not provided a proper X-Application-Key in the header of this request.

forbidden.description: The X-Application-Key provided is valid but the key does not have access to this resource.

notFound.description: The object with the given ID was not found OR a subscriber with the given URL was not found.

X-Application-Key.name: X-Application-Key
X-Application-Key.description: Used to authorize access to the Direct API.

subscriber_code.name: subscriber_code
subscriber_code.description: The code of the subscriber that you are making this request for.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limits the number of records returned by the API, up to a maximum of 1,000.

limit_continuation.name: limit
limit_continuation.description: Limits the number of records returned by the API, up to a maximum of 1,000.  The API may return less than the limit even when more records exist.  Always examine the 'next' and 'continuationToken' properties to determin if more records are available.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Offsets the number of records returned by the API.

modifiedUTCSince.name: modifiedUTCSince
modifiedUTCSince.description: A string specifies a datetime against which to filter the results. When specified the result will be ordered oldest __modifiedUTC to newest.  Example 2019-12-11T20:16:58.3419275Z. Optional. If unspecified, all cached objects will be returned.

continuationToken.name: continuationToken
continuationToken.description: A URL Encoded continuationToken value from a previous GET response.  When provided, the next set of results for the original GET will be returned.

tags.name: InEight InEight Application v1 Direct API
